result.title: :)
result.content:
Hello Everyone,

Weeks ago, we talked about these topics / problems:

Graph Coloring

We have implemented two solutions for this problem and compared the running time, the second solution was faster:

  • Backtracking: http://ideone.com/G6A6NO

  • Iterative Deepening: http://ideone.com/PiNNL8, you may read more about it here :)

Maximum Independent Set

We didn't write the code, but the idea is similar to the graph coloring problem. In this problem, you have to choose a set of nodes with the maximum number of nodes such that no two nodes are adjacent.

Here is a problem: http://www.spoj.com/problems/MAXISET/

I've suggested solving it using bitmasks, and here is my code, but please try to solve it first :).

Floyd-Warshall

We talked about two good problems, in the first one, we have to make use of the first loop of the algorithm, and in the second problem we have to update the dp table efficiently.

Here are the problems:

  • http://www.spoj.com/problems/RDNWK/

  • http://codeforces.com/contest/25/problem/C

You both said that you know it already so I didn't explain it, but I'm not sure if you know how to print the path between any pair of nodes (i, j) in this algorithm, here is the code of the algorithm with path printing: http://ideone.com/pYkZY5

You can find more problems in Floyd-Warshall sheet in ACM ACPC group (a2oj.com).

Knight Tour (Travelling Salesman)

We talked about the TSP problem and discussed the following problem since it requires a nice idea to handle the large chess board size:

Here is the problem: https://uva.onlinejudge.org/index.php?option=com_onlinejudge&Itemid=8&page=show_problem&problem=2690

And here is the DP function for the TSP: http://ideone.com/zNxaJU

Pushing Boxes

We talked about this problem as an example on Dijkstra's problems that require multi-dimensional states, and problems that require minimizing a second cost.

Problem like: https://uva.onlinejudge.org/index.php?option=com_onlinejudge&Itemid=8&page=show_problem&problem=530

The code we wrote: http://ideone.com/xnlzdi

2-SAT

We couldn't write any code, so I'll just post the code and the problems from Mixed Dimensions training:

  • http://codeforces.com/problemset/problem/228/E

  • http://codeforces.com/problemset/problem/27/D

  • https://uva.onlinejudge.org/index.php?option=onlinejudge&page=show_problem&problem=1260

  • https://uva.onlinejudge.org/index.php?option=onlinejudge&page=show_problem&problem=2269

  • http://www.spoj.com/problems/TORNJEVI/

The solution of the last problem: http://ideone.com/QajIpQ

:) :) :) :) :) :) :) :) :) :) :)

The following is a list of categorized of Gym problems that I think they are good (good problem != hard one), and some problems from other online judges. If you are planning to participate in Gyms virtually, don't try Gym problems below.

(Check the letter at the end of Gym links)
